intro: Viguiera palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Viguiera palmeri is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient plant in harsh climates.
